newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Indonesian late rubber stable in slow trading.
newsitem.headline: Indonesian late rubber stable in slow trading.

text.p: Indonesian tyre-grade SIR20 offer prices were stable in late trading on Thursday on the back of low consumer demand due to wintering in the U.S. and Europe.

Dealers said March SIR20 offer prices were stable 53.25 U.S. cents/lb fob Medan and at 53.00 fob Padang and Surabaya. "The market is still quiet as usual. But I heard a deal was done at 53.00 U.S. cents/lb in Palembang," said one dealer.
They said winter in the U.S. and Europe, which usually sees a slowdown in demand for tyre, had affected the local market.
Dealers earlier said it would be hard for rubber to reach the 53.50 U.S. cents/lb level because of the low demand.
